sen.j: 蘇我氏（そがのうじ、宗賀、宗我）は、古墳時代から飛鳥時代（6世紀 - 7世紀前半）に勢力を持っていた氏族。
sen.e: SOGA no Uji (SOGA clan; SOGA written as "宗賀" or "宗我") was a shizoku (clan) which held power from the Kofun period (tumulus period) to the Asuka period (the sixth century - the early seventh century).
SOGA no Uji (SOGA clan; SOGA written as "宗賀" or "宗我.") was a shizoku (clan) which ruled between the Kofun (tumulus) and Asuka periods (6th-7th centuries).
sen.cmt: "The sixth century - the seventh century" is stylistically redundant.
sen.e: Soga clan (Soga no uji) was a shizoku (clan) which ruled between the Kofun (tumulus) and Asuka periods (6th - 7th centuries).
sen.cmt: 漢字表記は不要と考え削除しました。Sogaに訂正しました。Soga clan (Soga no uji) に訂正しました。スペース補足しました。

sen.j: カバネは臣（おみ）で、代々大臣（おおおみ）を出していた有力豪族。
sen.e: SOGA clan's kabane (hereditary title) was Omi; SOGA clan was one of the powerful families and its members served as ministers for generations.
sen.cmt: If proper nouns are provided for in kanji, the same treatment should be accorded to 「臣」
sen.e: The SOGA clan's kabane (hereditary title) was Omi (臣), and it was an influential local family whose members successively served as ministers over several generations.
sen.cmt: Included the kanji for the proper noun 臣 and its romanization in "brackets."
sen.e: The Soga clan's kabane (hereditary title) was Omi, and it was an influential local family whose members successively served as ministers over several generations.
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。（臣）削除しました。

sen.j: 蘇我『日本書紀』
sen.e: SOGA was written as "蘇我" in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: written--> transcribe
sen.e: SOGA is inscribed as "蘇我" in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: Present tense "is" is applied rather than "was" in describing the expression on a historical document. Written-> transcribed
sen.e: Soga is inscribed as "蘇我" in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: 宗我『先代旧事本紀』天孫本紀、『上宮聖徳法王帝説』、『日本三代実録』
sen.e: It was also written as "宗我" in "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History): Lineage of the Mononobe and Soga Clans, "Jogu Shotoku Hooteisetsu" (Biography of Shotoku Taishi), and "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (Veritable Records of Three Reigns of Japan).

It was alternatively recorded as "宗我" in the "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History): Lineage of the Mononobe and Soga Clans, "Jogu Shotoku Hooteisetsu" (Biography of Shotoku Taishi), and "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (Veritable Records of Three Reigns of Japan).
sen.cmt: Inscribe has a stronger nuisance of "recording" rather than merely writing.
sen.e: It was alternatively recorded as "宗我" in the "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History): Lineage of the Mononobe and Soga clans, "Jogu Shotoku Hooteisetsu" (Biography of Shotoku Taishi), and "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (Veritable Records of Three Reigns of Japan).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。clans小文字にしました。

sen.j: 巷奇『元興寺縁起帳』
sen.e: It was written as "巷奇" in "The Origin of Gango-ji Temple."
It was written as Koki (巷奇)in "The Origin of Gango-ji Temple."
sen.cmt: The pronunciation of "巷奇" was not provided by the translator. I have not been able to verify my translation using available dictionaries.
sen.e: It was written as "巷奇" in "The Origin of Gango-ji Temple."
sen.cmt: 表記の話題で、読みは不要と考え削除しました。スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 『古事記』や『日本書紀』では神功皇后の三韓征伐などで活躍した武内宿禰（たけしうちのすくね）を祖としている。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki," SOGA clan descended from TAKENOUCHI no Sukune who had a great success in "Sankan Seibatsu" (The Conquest of the Three Korean Kingdoms) lead by Empress Jingu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), the SOGA clan descended from TAKENOUCHI no Sukune who achievedgreat success in the "Sankan Seibatsu" (Punitive Expeditions Against the Three Korean Kingdoms) led by Empress Jingu.
sen.cmt: The use of the word "Conquest" is misleading, and should be translated as "punitive expeditions."Simple Typo "lead"--> "led."
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), the Soga clan descended from TAKESHIUCHI no Sukune who achieved great success in the Sankan Seibatsu (Punitive Expeditions Against the Three Korean Kingdoms) led by Empress Jingu.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。Soga小文字にしました。原文に合せて、TAKESHIUCHIに訂正しました。原文に合せて" "削除しました。

sen.j: しかし、具体的な活動が記述されるのは6世紀中頃の蘇我稲目（そが・の・いなめ）からで、それ以前に関してはよく分かっていない。
sen.e: However, the concrete accounts were not recorded until SOGA no Iname appeared in the mid-sixth century; therefore, what happened before his time is not was not known well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the specific accounts were not recorded until SOGA no Iname appeared in the mid-6th century, and events before that remain largely unknown.
sen.cmt: 記述--> recorded until
sen.e: However, the specific accounts were not recorded until SOGA no Iname appeared in the mid-6th century, and events before that remain largely unknown.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 河内の石川 (現在の大阪府の石川 (大阪府)流域、人によっては詳細に南河内郡河南町一須賀あたり)、あるいは葛城県蘇我里（現在の奈良県橿原市曽我町あたり）を本拠にした土着の豪族であった。
sen.e: One theory says that SOGA clan was a powerful family that was a native of the area around Kawachi Province by Ishikawa River (present-day Ishikawa River basin in Osaka Prefecture; some say precisely Ichisuka Kanan-cho, Minamikawachi-gun) or Soga no Sato, Katsuragi Prefecture (present-day Soga-cho, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: One theory states that SOGA clan was a powerful family that was a native to the area around Kawachi Province by Ishikawa River (present-day Ishikawa River basin in Osaka Prefecture; some even identify the precise location as Ichisuka Kanan-cho, Minamikawachi-gun), or Soga no Sato, Katsuragi Prefecture (present-day Soga-cho, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture).
sen.cmt: Stylistic changes
sen.e: One theory states that Soga clan was a powerful family that was a native to the area around Kawachi Province by Ishikawa River (present-day Ishikawa River basin in Osaka Prefecture; some even identify the precise location as Ichisuka Kanan-cho, Minamikawachi-gun), or Soga no Sato, Katsuragi Prefecture (present-day Soga-cho, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture).
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: または（系譜に現れる名前などから）その地に定住した百済系渡来人であった、などの説があるがいずれも定かではない。
sen.e: Another theory says that (based on the names appear in the family tree records) SOGA clan descended from the escendents of clans migrated from Kudara (Baekje; one of three kingdoms in southern Korean Peninsula in Ancient periods) and settled there; however, none of these theories is proven.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yet, another theory (based on tracing lineage) suggests that the SOGA clan descended from the migrant clans from Kudara (Baekje; one of three kingdoms on the Korean Peninsula) and settled there; however, these theories are yet to be verified.
sen.cmt: Stylistic changes
sen.e: Yet, another theory (based on tracing lineage) suggests that the Soga clan descended from the migrant clans from Kudara (Baekje; one of three kingdoms on the Korean Peninsula) and settled there; however, these theories are yet to be verified.
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: 『新撰姓氏録』は蘇我氏を皇別（歴代天皇から分かれた氏族）に分類している。
sen.e: The Shinsen Shojiroku (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility) classified SOGA clan as Kobetsu (clan descended from successive emperors).
The Shinsen Shojiroku (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility) classifies SOGA clan as Kobetsu (clan descended from successive emperors).
sen.cmt: Past to present tense when referring to historical documents. Classified--> classifies
sen.e: The "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility) classifies Soga clan as Kobetsu (clan descended from successive emperors).
sen.cmt: 原文の『』に合せて" "補足しました。Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: 蘇我氏自身の出自はともかく、渡来系の氏族と深い関係にあったのは確かなようで、王権の職業奴属民としての役割を担っていた渡来人の品部の集団などが持つ当時の先進技術が蘇我氏の台頭の一助になったと考えられている。
sen.e: Apart from the controversy over SOGA clan's origin, it was certain that SOGA clan had deep ties with the clans of immigrants to ancient Japan; the emergence of SOGA clan's power was thought to be helped by advanced technology of the time which was introduced to Japan by a group of Shinabe (technicians in offices) who were toraijin (settlers) and played a role of servants with professional skills for the sovereignty of the time.

Regardless of the origins of the SOGA clan, its deep ties with migrant clans is without-doubt, immigrants to ancient Japan; and it is thought that the rise of the SOGA clan was aided by the relatively advanced technologies's introduced to Japan by Shinabe (technicians in offices) who were toraijin (settlers), who became subjects to royal authority as indentured professionals.
sen.cmt: Apart from the controversy over---> regardless of
sen.e: Regardless of the origins of the Soga clan, its deep ties with migrant clans is without-doubt, immigrants to ancient Japan; and it is thought that the rise of the Soga clan was aided by the relatively advanced technologies introduced to Japan by Shinabe (technicians in offices) who were toraijin (settlers), who became subjects to royal authority as indentured professionals.
sen.cmt: technologies訂正しました。Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: また、仏教が日本の仏教飛鳥時代（伝来）した際にそれをいち早く取り入れたのも蘇我氏であったとされる。
sen.e: In addition, SOGA clan was known to be the first to adopt Buddhism when it was introduced in the Asuka period in Japan.
Additionally, it is widely assumed that the SOGA clan was the first to adopt Buddhism when it was introduced to Japan during the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: "is known to be" is not true to the source sentence.
sen.e: Additionally, it is widely assumed that the Soga clan was the first to adopt Buddhism when it was introduced to Japan during the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: これは、朝廷の祭祀を任されていた連姓の物部氏、中臣氏を牽制する為の目的も有ったと推察される。
sen.e: SOGA clan probably did so in order to counter Mononobe and Nakatomi clans that were in charge of Saishi (religious services) in Chotei (Imperial Court).

This is conjectured to have been carried out by the Soga clan for the purpose of countering the Monobe and Nakatomi clans that were appointed to perform Saishi (religious rites and services) in the Chotei (Imperial Court).
sen.cmt: Stylistic changes.
sen.e: This is conjectured to have been carried out by the Soga clan for the purpose of countering the Mononobe and Nakatomi clans that were appointed to perform Saishi (religious rites and services) in the Chotei (Imperial Court).
sen.cmt: Mononobeに訂正しました。

sen.j: 6世紀後半には今の奈良県高市郡近辺を勢力下においていたと思われる。
sen.e: SOGA clan thought to hold power over the area of present-day Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture in the latter half of the sixth century.
The SOGA clan is thought to have ruled over an area covering present-day Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture by the latter half of the sixth century.
sen.cmt: Rewording
sen.e: The Soga clan is thought to have ruled over an area covering present-day Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture by the latter half of the sixth century.
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 蘇我氏が政治の実権を掌握した時代から、飛鳥に集中的に天皇の宮がおかれるようになったことからもそれがうかがえる。
sen.e: The rise of SOGA clan's power was implied in the fact that many of the emperor's palaces were build in the Asuka area since they came to hold the real political power.
The SOGA clan's rise to power is signified in the construction of several imperial palaces in Asuka after they seized power.
sen.cmt: Rewording
sen.e: The Soga clan's rise to power is signified in the construction of several imperial palaces in Asuka after they seized power.
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: 全盛期
sen.e: Zensei-ki (at the Height of its Prosperity)
Zensei-ki (Height of Prosperity)
sen.cmt: Rewording
sen.e: Height of Prosperity
sen.cmt: 読みは不要と考え削除しました。

sen.j: 稲目の代になると、過去に大臣を出していた葛城氏や平群氏は既に本宗家の滅亡により勢いをなくしていた。
sen.e: The main family branches of Katsuragi and Hegri clans whose members served as ministers in the past became extinguished and therefore the clans had lost their powers by Iname's generation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Katsuragi and Heguri clans, whose members served as ministers in the past, had lost their respective influence by Iname's generation due to the demise of the main branches of their clans.
sen.cmt: Incorrect Romanization.
sen.e: The Katsuragi and Heguri clans, whose members served as ministers in the past, had lost their respective influence by Iname's generation due to the demise of the main branches of their clans.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 蘇我氏は連の大伴氏と物部氏にならぶ三大勢力の一角となり、やがて大伴金村が失脚すると、大連 (古代日本)の物部氏（物部尾輿）と大臣の蘇我（稲目）の二大勢力となる。
sen.e: SOGA clan became one of the three major powers alongside Muraji Otomo and Mononobe clans; after OTOMO no Kanamura was overthrown, Omuraji (of ancient Japanese) Mononobe clan (MONONOBE no Okoshi) and the minister SOGA no Iname remained as the two major powers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: SOGA clan became one of three major powers alongside the Muraji Otomo and Mononobe clans; after OTOMO no Kanamura was overthrown, the Monobe (MONONOBE no Okoshi) clan Omuraji (Official post in ancient Japan.) and the minister SOGA no Iname remained as the two major powers.
sen.cmt: This sentence needs to be looked over again. I believe the translator is conflating individual rivalries with those of the clan, which leads to confusion.
sen.e: Soga clan became one of three major powers alongside the Muraji Otomo and Mononobe clans; after OTOMO no Kanamura was overthrown, the Mononobe (MONONOBE no Okoshi) clan Omuraji (Official post in ancient Japan.) and the minister SOGA no Iname remained as the two major powers.
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。Mononobeに訂正しました。

sen.j: また、過去の葛城氏や後の藤原氏同様、娘蘇我堅塩媛、小姉君を欽明天皇に嫁がせることにより天皇家の外戚となっていく。
sen.e: Like Katsuragi clan before his time or Fujiwara clan after his time, he married his daughters, SOGA no Kitashihime and Oane no Kimi, to Emperor Kinmei and SOGA clan became the imperial family's maternal relative.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Soga also followed the precedent set by the Katsuragi and Fujiwara clans by marrying off his daughters SOGA no Kitashihime and Oane no Kimi to Emperor Kinmei, and established himself as a maternal relative of the imperial family.
sen.cmt: "Soga" is clearly stated as the subject to add clarity to the sentence.
sen.e: Soga also followed the precedent set by the Katsuragi and Fujiwara clans by marrying off his daughters SOGA no Kitashihime and Oane no Kimi to Emperor Kinmei, and established himself as a maternal relative of the imperial family.
sen.cmt: Imperial大文字にしました。

sen.j: （馬子の本居（ウブスナ）が葛城県だったことから、稲目の妻は葛城氏の出で、その血統に連なることにより、天皇へ妃を輩出出来る一族に連なったとする説もある）。
sen.e: Because Umako's main residence was in Katsuragi-ken, one theory says that Iname's wife was from Katsuragi clan and because of the blood tie SOGA clan became one of the noble families from which emperor's wives were chosen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (It is speculated that the SOGA clan became one of the noble families from which the Emperor'wives were chosen by virtue of their blood ties and the fact that Umako's primary residence (Ubusuna) was in Katsuragi-ken, and Iname's wife was also from Katsuragi.)
sen.cmt: Brackets added. The sentence has been corrected to conform to the Japanese original.
sen.e: (It is speculated that the Soga clan became one of the noble families from which the Emperor's wives were chosen by virtue of their blood ties and the fact that Umako's primary residence (Ubusuna) was in Katsuragi-ken, and Iname's wife was also from Katsuragi.)
sen.cmt: the Emperor's wivesに訂正しました。Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: 稲目は欽明天皇とほぼ同時期に没し、二大勢力の構図は次代の蘇我馬子（そが・の・うまこ）まで引き継がれるが、用明天皇没後に後継者をめぐる争いがあった。
sen.e: Iname and Emperor Kinmei died at approximately the same period, and two major powers survived as such until the next, SOGA no Umako's, generation; however, there was a battle over the succession after Emperor Yomei's death.

The political structure characterized by the dominance of two major houses was inherited by SOGA no Umako after the deaths of Iname in 570 and Emperor Kinmei in 571; However, a conflict over succession erupted after Emperor Yomei's death.
sen.cmt: Sentence order altered. (return to this again). Date of deaths included to avoid vague and cumbersome phrasing.
sen.e: The political structure characterized by the dominance of two major houses was inherited by SOGA no Umako after the deaths of Iname in 570 and Emperor Kinmei in 571; However, a conflict over succession erupted after Emperor Yomei's death.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 蘇我氏は、小姉君の子ながらも物部氏に擁立されていた穴穂部皇子を暗殺し、戦いで物部守屋を討ち滅ぼした。
sen.e: SOGA clan murdered Anahobe no Miko who was backed up by Mononobe clan despite the fact that (SOGA no) Oane no Kimi was his mother and defeated MONONOBE no Moriya in the battle; after that no one was appointed to Omuraji but SOGA clan members, and SOGA clan became the only dominant power in the politics.

The SOGA clan assasinated Anahobe no Miko who was supported by the MONONOBE clan, despite the fact that Anahobe no Miko was the son of (SOGA no) Oane no Kimi, and defeated MONONOBE no Moriya in the battle. After this event, the SOGA clan members monopolized appointments to Omuraji, and governance became unipolarized under their dominance.
sen.cmt: Separated into two sentences for coherence. I object to the original document because SOGA no Umako ordered the assasination of Anahobe no Miko. So a historically accurate translation would begin as follows : "SOGA no Umako orderd the assasination of Anahobe no Miko"
sen.e: The Soga clan assassinated Anahobe no Miko who was supported by the Mononobe clan, despite the fact that Anahobe no Miko was the son of (SOGA no) Oane no Kimi, and defeated MONONOBE no Moriya in the battle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。Sogaに訂正しました。Mononobeに訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: その後は蘇我氏以外からは大連に任じられる者も出ず、政権は蘇我氏の一極体制となる。
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: After this event, the Soga clan members monopolized appointments to Omuraji, and governance became unipolarized under their dominance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: ここから馬子による崇峻天皇の暗殺や、推古天皇への葛城県の割譲の要求、蘇我蝦夷（えみし）による天皇をないがしろにするふるまい、蘇我入鹿（そが・の・いるか）による上宮王家（山背大兄王）の討滅、境部摩理勢の失脚などの専横ぶりが伝えられており、蘇我氏三代にわたって権力を欲しいがままにしたとされている。
sen.e: Since then SOGA clan was known for its tyrannical ways such as Umako's assassination of Emperor Sushun, the demand of cession of Katsuragi-ken from Empress Suiko, SOGA no Emishi's actions to negate the authority of the emperor, SOGA no Iruka's coup against Jogu Oke, Prince Yamashiro no Oe, the overthrowing of SAKAIBE no Marise's; three generations of SOGA clan allegedly possessed the absolute power.

The abuse of power under three generations of the SOGA clan can be gleaned from events such as the assasination of Emperor Sushun by SOGA no Umako, the demand for the ceding of Katsuragi-ken from Empress Suiko, neglect of the throne by SOGA no Emishi, and the coup against Jogu Ooke (Prince Yamashiro no oe) by SOGA no Iruka, and the overthrow of SAKAIBE no Marise.
sen.cmt: Stylistic changes.
sen.e: The abuse of power under three generations of the Soga clan can be gleaned from events such as the assassination of Emperor Sushun by SOGA no Umako, the demand for the ceding of Katsuragi-ken from Empress Suiko, neglect of the throne by SOGA no Emishi, and the coup against Jogu Ooke (Prince Yamashiro no oe) by SOGA no Iruka, and the overthrow of SAKAIBE no Marise.
sen.cmt: assassinationスペル訂正しました、Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: しかし馬子の死後に、蘇我氏に対する皇族や諸豪族の反感が高まって蘇我氏の政治基盤が動揺し、それを克服しようとして入鹿による強権政治に繋がった、という見方も少なからずある。
sen.e: However, according to one viewpoint accepted by some the reason for Iruka's hard-line approach to politics was to overcome antipathy against SOGA clan which was on the rise from the imperial family and other powerful families after Umako's death and lead to the weakening of SOGA clan's political base.

However, there are also those who view Iruka's hardline politics as having been motivated by his desire to overcome the weakness of a political base undermined by antipathy among the imperial family and other influential familities towards the SOGA clan after the death of SOGA no Umako.
sen.cmt: Style and Readability
sen.e: However, there are also those who view Iruka's hard-line politics as having been motivated by his desire to overcome the weakness of a political base undermined by antipathy among the Imperial family and other influential families towards the Soga clan after the death of SOGA no Umako.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。familiesスペル訂正しました。Imperial大文字にしました。Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: これは『日本書紀』等による蘇我氏に否定的な記述に対する反論である。
sen.e: This viewpoint is the counter argument to the negative descriptions of SOGA clan found in "Nihonshoki" and others.
This refutes the negative portrayals of the SOGA clan found in historical records such as the "Nihonshoki."
sen.cmt: In Japanese 「これ」is nominalized as 「反論である」、but when this is translated into english stylistically it would be better translated as verb "counters."
sen.e: This refutes the negative portrayals of the Soga clan found in historical records such as the "Nihonshoki."
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: 蘇我氏は、645年の天智天皇、藤原鎌足らのクーデター（乙巳の変）によって、入鹿が暗殺されるとともに蝦夷が自殺するとその勢力は大幅にそがれてしまった。
sen.e: SOGA clan's power was significantly diminished when Iruka was murdered and Emishi committed suicide in Isshi-no-hen (the Murder in the Year of Isshi) lead by Emperor Tenchi and FUJIWARA no Kamatari in 645.

The power of the SOGA clan was significantly diminished by a coup (Isshi Incident, which takes its name from the Zodialogical name of the year the incident occurred and can alternatively called the "Incident of 645.") led by Emperor Tenchi in 645, in which Iruka was assassinated and Emishi prompted to commit suicide.
sen.cmt: The term "Isshi no Hen"needs to be changed to "Isshi Incident." Spelling error "lead"--> "led."
sen.e: The power of the Soga clan was significantly diminished by a coup (Isshi Incident, which takes its name from the Zodiacal name of the year the incident occurred and can alternatively called the "Incident of 645.") led by Emperor Tenchi in 645, in which Iruka was assassinated and Emishi prompted to commit suicide.
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: 大化の改新から壬申の乱まで
sen.e: From Taika no Kaishin (Taika Era) to the Jinshin War
From the Taika Reforms to the Jinshin Rebellion.
sen.cmt: I don't think there is any need to use the Japanese term for Taika reform for the title of a paragraph, when the English term suffices.
sen.e: From the Taika Reforms to the Jinshin Rebellion.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかしながらこの政変はあくまでも蝦夷を嫡流とする蘇我氏宗本家の滅亡だけを意味する。
sen.e: However, this coup only decimated the SOGA clan's main branch of the family directly descended from Emishi.
The political turmoil merely signified the decimation of the main branch of the SOGA clan whose members were direct descendents of Emishi.
sen.cmt: Clarity
sen.e: The political turmoil merely signified the decimation of the main branch of the Soga clan whose members were direct descendents of Emishi.
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: クーデターには、傍流とされた蘇我倉麻呂（蝦夷の弟）の子である蘇我倉山田石川麻呂も、中大兄皇子の協力者として関わっていた。
sen.e: OGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro, a child of SOGA no Kuramaro (Emishi's younger brother) from the branch family of SOGA, participated in the coup as Naka no Oe no Oji's ally.
OGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro, a child of SOGA no Kuramaro (Emishi's younger brother) from the branch family of SOGA, conspired with Naka no Oe no Oji in the coup.
sen.cmt: 「協力者として関わった」better translated as "conspired with" considering the context in which Ogakura-Yamada no Ishikawamaro collaborated with Naka no Oe no Oji.
sen.e: SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro, a child of SOGA no Kuramaro (Emishi's younger brother) from the branch family of Soga, conspired with Naka no Oe no Oji in the coup.
sen.cmt: SOGANOKURAに訂正しました。Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: 石川麻呂はこの後右大臣に任じられ、娘の遠智娘と姪娘を中大兄皇子の后にしている。
sen.e: Later, Ishikawamaro was appointed to Udaijin (minister of the right) and arranged to marry his daughters, Ochi no Iratsume and Mei no Iratsume, to Naka no Oe no Oji.
Later, Ishikawamaro was appointed to Udaijin (Minister of the rrzight) and arranged to marry off his daughters Ochi no Iratsume and Mei no Iratsume to Naka no Oe no Oji.
sen.cmt: Transitive verb "marry off."Commas also deleted. Official posting capitalized.
sen.e: Later, Ishikawamaro was appointed to Udaijin (Minister of the right) and arranged to marry off his daughters Ochi no Iratsume and Mei no Iratsume to Naka no Oe no Oji.
sen.cmt: rightスペル訂正しました。

sen.j: 石川麻呂自身は649年に冤罪で自害し、讒言した弟の蘇我日向も大宰府に左遷させられた（口封じとの説もある）。
sen.e: Ishikawamaro himself comitted suicide over a false charge in 649, and his younger brother, SOGA no Himuka, who started the charge was demoted and transferred to Dazaifu (some say, to keep him quiet).

Ishikawamaro himself was prompted to commit suicide when he was falsely charged in 649, and his younger brother, SOGA no Himuka, whose accusations led to his Ishikawamaro's death was demoted and transferred to Dazaifu (It is speculated that SOGA no Himuka was transferred as a means to keep him silenced.).
sen.cmt: Style and Clarity
sen.e: Ishikawamaro himself was prompted to commit suicide when he was falsely charged in 649, and his younger brother, SOGA no Himuka, whose accusations led to his Ishikawamaro's death was demoted and transferred to Dazaifu (It is speculated that SOGA no Himuka was transferred as a means to keep him silenced.)
sen.cmt: コンマを削除しました。

sen.j: しかし、他の弟である蘇我赤兄と蘇我連子は、天智天皇の時代に大臣（赤兄は左大臣、連子ははっきりは分からないが右大臣と推定されている）に任じられており、蘇我氏は一定の地位を保持している。
sen.e: However, Ishikawamaro's other brothers, SOGA no Akae and SOGA no Murajiko, were appointed to ministers; Akae was to sadaijin (minister of the left) and Murajiko was supposedly to Udaijin in Emperor Tenchi's era and SOGA clan maintained its position at an acceptable level.

However, Ishikawamaro's other brothers SOGA no Akae and SOGA no Murajiko were respectively appointed as Minister of the Left and Minister of the Right (Although the veracity of Murajiko's appointment is less certain.) during the reign of Emperor Tenchi, and the SOGA clan maintained a certain degree of status.
sen.cmt: Placement of commas altered. Style altered.
sen.e: However, Ishikawamaro's other brothers SOGA no Akae and SOGA no Murajiko were respectively appointed as Minister of the Left and Minister of the Right (Although the veracity of Murajiko's appointment is less certain.) during the reign of Emperor Tenchi, and the Soga clan maintained a certain degree of status.
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: 連子は天智天皇の正式な即位を見ないまま死去し、赤兄ともう一人の弟である蘇我果安は壬申の乱で弘文天皇側について敗れ、それぞれ流罪・自害となった。
sen.e: Murajiko died before Emperor Tenchi's official enthroned; Akae and his other brother, SOGA no Hatayasu, supported Emperor Kobun in the Jinshin War and were defeated; Akae was deported and Hatayasu committed suicide.

Murajiko died before Emperor Tenchi was officially enthroned, and Akae and his other younger brother SOGA no Hatayasu both of whom took the side of Emperor Kobun during the Jinshin War were respectively deported and prompted to commit suicide upon their defeat.
sen.cmt: Style
sen.e: Murajiko died before Emperor Tenchi was officially enthroned, and Akae and his other younger brother SOGA no Hatayasu both of whom took the side of Emperor Kobun during the Jinshin War were respectively deported and prompted to commit suicide upon their defeat.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その甥で連子の子である蘇我安麻呂は、天武天皇の信任が厚かったために蘇我氏の後を継ぎ、石川朝臣の姓氏を賜った。
sen.e: SOGA no Yasumaro, a nephew of Akae and a child of Murajiko was trusted by Emperor Tenmu and succeeded SOGA clan; he was awarded the family name, ISHIKAWA Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles) by Emperor Tenmu.

SOGA no Yasumaro, a nephew of Akae and the son of Murajiko was trusted by Emperor Tenmu to the extent that he was entrusted the succession of the SOGA clan and was bestowed the family name ISHIKAWA Ason (second highest of eight hereditary titles).
sen.cmt: Style
sen.e: SOGA no Yasumaro, a nephew of Akae and the son of Murajiko was trusted by Emperor Tenmu to the extent that he was entrusted the succession of the Soga clan and was bestowed the family name ISHIKAWA Ason (second highest of eight hereditary titles).
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: このように乙巳の変後も、倉麻呂の息子達がなお政治の中心的立場にとどまり、相次ぐ政争で衰退しながらもしばらくは連子の系統が続いた。
sen.e: Kuramaro's sons remained in the center of the politics even after Isshi-no-hen like the Yasumaro's example and despite the declining power over a series of political dispute, Murajiko's lineage survived for some time.
Kuramaro's sons remained in the center of politics even after the Isshi Incident, and maintained Murajiko's lineage even as their influence was whittled down through successive political struggles.
sen.cmt: Removal of "the" before "politics." Style improved.
sen.e: Kuramaro's sons remained in the center of politics even after the Isshi Incident, and maintained Murajiko's lineage even as their influence was whittled down through successive political struggles.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 蘇我系石川朝臣
sen.e: ISHIKAWA Ason of SOGA's Lineage
ISHIKAWA Ason of SOGA's Lineage
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: ISHIKAWA Ason of Soga's Lineage
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: 蘇我系石川氏は、飛鳥時代末期から奈良時代に、その血を引いた天皇（持統天皇と元明天皇を輩出した（それぞれ石川麻呂の娘、遠智娘と姪娘が母）。
sen.e: ISHIKAWA Ason of SOGA's lineage produced empresses, Empress Jito and Empress Genmei, who were of SOGA's blood; Ochi no Iratsume and Mei no Iratsume, daughters of Ishikawamaro, were respectively Empress Jito's and Empress Genmei's mothers in the last years of Asuka Period to Nara period.

ISHIKAWA Ason of Soga lineage produced Empress Jito and Empress Genmei who assumed the throne from the late Nara period through to the Asuka period (Both Empress Jito and Empress Genmei were the daughters of Ishikawamaro and were respectively mothered by Ochino Iratsume and Mei no Iratsume.)
sen.cmt: Trans 1 is erroneously translated.
sen.e: ISHIKAWA Ason of Soga lineage produced Empress Jito and Empress Genmei who assumed the throne from the late Nara period through to the Asuka period (both Empress Jito and Empress Genmei were the daughters of Ishikawamaro and were respectively mothered by Ochi no Iratsume and Mei no Iratsume.)
sen.cmt: both小文字にしました。不要なスペースを削除しました。スペース補足しました。

sen.j: しかしながら、蘇我赤兄の外孫である山辺皇女が、持統天皇に排除された夫の大津皇子に殉死したり、また文武天皇の妻の石川刀子娘が、天皇崩御後に某男との関係を持った事からその身分を剥奪され、子の広成皇子・広世皇子も連座して皇族の身分を剥奪される事件なども起こしている。
sen.e: However, there were several unfortunate incidents: Princess Yamanobeno Himemiko, SOGA no Akae's sotomago (grandchild from a daughter married into another family) followed her husband, Imperial Prince Otsu who was eliminated by Empress Jito, to the grave. ISHIKAWA no Tone no Iratsume, Emperor Monmu's wife, was robbed of her social standing because she had a relationship with a certain man after the emperor's death and her children, Hironari no Oji and Hiroyo no Oji, were implicated and also robbed of their social standings as members of the imperial family.

However, several unfortunate incidents befell the throne : Princess Yamanobeno Himemiko, a sotomago (grandchild from a daughter married into another family) of SOGA no Akae followed her husband Imperial Prince Otsu to the grave when he was eliminated by Empress Jito, and ISHIKAWA no Tone no Iratsume, the wife of the late Emperor Monmu, was stripped of her rank due to infidelity and her children Hironari no Oji and Hiroyo no Oji were stripped of their standing as members of the imperial family by association.
sen.cmt: Sentence structure altered for added clarity. Stylistic changes applied.
sen.e: However, several unfortunate incidents befell the throne: Princess Yamanobe no Himemiko, a sotomago (grandchild from a daughter married into another family) of SOGA no Akae followed her husband Imperial Prince Otsu to the grave when he was eliminated by Empress Jito, and ISHIKAWA no Tone no Iratsume, the wife of the late Emperor Monmu, was stripped of her rank due to infidelity and her children Hironari no Oji and Hiroyo no Oji were stripped of their standing as members of the Imperial family by association.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。スペース補足しました。Imperial大文字にしました。

sen.j: 刀子娘の事件は、異母兄弟の首皇子の競争相手を排除しようとしての藤原不比等・県犬養三千代夫婦の陰謀とされる。
sen.e: Tone no Iratsume's incident allegedly was a conspiracy of FUJIWARA no Fuhito and his wife Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo in order to eliminate rivals for Prince Obito who was Fuhito's brother by a different mother.

The Tone no Iratsume's incident is allegedly a conspiracy hatched by FUJIWARA no Fuhito and his wife Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo to eliminate rivals and ensure the enthronement of Prince Obito, who was Fuhito's half brother born from a different mother.
sen.cmt: Style
sen.e: The Tone no Iratsume's incident is allegedly a conspiracy hatched by FUJIWARA no Fuhito and his wife Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo to eliminate rivals and ensure the enthronement of Prince Obito, who was Fuhito's half brother born from a different mother.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また万葉集によれば、同じ赤兄の外孫である穂積親王も但馬皇女との密通が露見して左遷された。
sen.e: According to "Manyoshu" (the oldest anthology of tanka), Imperial Prince Hozumi, also Akae's sotomago, was accused of adultery with Tajima no Himemiko and demoted.
According to "Manyoshu" (the oldest anthology of tanka), Imperial Prince Hozumi, a sotomago of Akae, was accused of adultery with Tajima no Himemiko and demoted.
sen.cmt: Style
sen.e: According to "Manyoshu" (the oldest anthology of tanka), Imperial Prince Hozumi, a sotomago of Akae, was accused of adultery with Tajima no Himemiko and demoted.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 穂積皇子は、幸いにも持統崩御後に太政大臣に出世したが、若くして亡くなった。
sen.e: Fortunately, Imperial Prince Hozumi moved up to Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister) after Empress Jito's death; however, he died young.
Imperial Prince Hozumi was fortunate enough to have climbed the ranks to Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister) after Empress Jito's death; however, he died young.
sen.cmt: Style
sen.e: Imperial Prince Hozumi was fortunate enough to have climbed the ranks to Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister) after Empress Jito's death; however, he died young.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 不比等の正妻は、安麻呂の娘の蘇我娼子（藤原武智麻呂・藤原房前・藤原宇合の母）である。
sen.e: Fuhito's legal wife was SOGA no Masako (a mother of FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasak, and FUJIWARA no Umakai) who was Yasumaro 's daughter.
Fuhito's legal wife was SOGA no Masako who was Yasumaro 's daughter (and the mother of FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, and FUJIWARA no Umakai).
sen.cmt: Spelling error.
sen.e: Fuhito's legal wife was SOGA no Masako who was Yasumaro's daughter (and the mother of FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, and FUJIWARA no Umakai).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: その故を持って、その弟の石川石足と子の石川年足は、当時嫡流とされた武智麻呂を祖とする藤原南家と結びつくようになる。
sen.e: Because of Masako's marriage to Fuhito, Yasumaro's brothers, ISHIKAWA no Iwatari and his son ISHIKAWA no Toshitari, were associated with the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan which was said to be directly descended from Muchimaro.

Yasumaro's younger brother ISHIKAWA no Iwatari and his son ISHIKAWA no Toshitari became associated with the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan which was directly descended from Muchimaro by virtue of Masako's marriage to Fuhito.
sen.cmt: Familial relations misstranslated.
sen.e: Yasumaro's younger brother ISHIKAWA no Iwatari and his son ISHIKAWA no Toshitari became associated with the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan which was directly descended from Muchimaro by virtue of Masako's marriage to Fuhito.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 年足は、武智麻呂次男の藤原仲麻呂が設立した紫微中台の大弼としてその補佐に当たり、中流貴族としてなんとかその命脈を保った。
sen.e: Toshitari served and supported Shibi chudai (the office handled the principal empress Komyo's affairs) which was established by FUJIWARA no Nakamaro, the second son of Muchimaro, as Daihitsu and barely kept his standing as a middle-class nobility.

Toshitari served as Daibi to the Shibi chudai (Office which handled the affairs of Empress Komyo) which was established by FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (the second son of Muchimaro), and barely maintained his standing as a middle class nobility.
sen.cmt: I cannot verify the definition of Shibi Chudai in the parenthesis.
sen.e: Toshitari served as Daihitsu (senior assistant president) to the Shibi chudai (the office handled the principal Empress Komyo's affairs) which was established by FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (the second son of Muchimaro), and barely maintained his standing as a middle class nobility.
sen.cmt: 紫微中台→Shibi chudai (the office handled the principal Empress Komyo's affairs)大弼→Daihitsu (senior assistant president) 用語集より訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 衰退
sen.e: Decline
Decline
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Decline
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、その藤原南家が藤原仲麻呂の乱で衰退してしまうと、石川氏も平安京遷都後亡くなった正四位上・参議、石川真守（年足の孫、馬子の7代孫）を最後に公卿は出なくなり、歴史から姿を消した。
sen.e: Hoever, the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan declined after FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War and Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank Upper Grade) Sangi (Councillor) ISHIKAWA no Mamori, Toshitari's glandchild and the seventh generation of Umako's grandchildren, died after the transfer of national capital to the city of Heian-kyo; Mamori being the last in the line, Ishikawa clan failed to produce another Kugyo (court noble) and banished from the history.

However, as the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan entered a terminal decline after FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's Rebellion, the ISHIKAWA clan would share the same fate. Aftter Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank Upper Grade) Sangi (Councillor) ISHIKAWA no Mamori (Toshitari's grandchild and the seventh generation of Umako's grandchildren) died following the transfer of the capital to the Heian-kyo, the ISHIKAWA clan failed to produce other kugyo (court noble) and would vanish from history.
sen.cmt: This sentence has been separated into two for the purpose of maintaining coherence. Spelling errors. Misstranslation of 藤原仲麻呂の乱 into "FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War" when it should be "FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's Rebellion.
sen.e: However, as the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan entered a terminal decline after FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's Rebellion, the Ishikawa clan also failed to produce other kugyo (court noble) succeeding ISHIKAWA no Mamori (Toshitari's grandchild and the seventh generation of Umako's grandchildren), who was Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and sangi (Councillor), died after the transfer of the capital to the Heian-kyo, and would vanish from history.
sen.cmt: Afterスペル訂正しました。文章訂正しました。Ishikawaに訂正しました。コンマ補足しました。一文に訂正しました。

sen.j: 蘇我氏の血統は、藤原不比等に嫁いで藤原武智麻呂、藤原房前、藤原宇合の三男を儲けた蘇我娼子を通して女系ではあるが現代にも伝わっている。
sen.e: SOGA clan's blood line is still passed down to the present day as female line through SOGA no Masako who married FUJIWARA no Fuhito and had three sons, FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki;, and FUJIWARA no Umakai.

SOGA clan's lineage continues to the present day through the maternal line of SOGA no Masako who married FUJIWARA no Fuhito and gave birth to three sons: FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, and FUJIWARA no Umakai.
sen.cmt: Minor change to terms. Semicolon deleted.
sen.e: Soga clan's lineage continues to the present day through the maternal line of SOGA no Masako who married FUJIWARA no Fuhito and gave birth to three sons: FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, and FUJIWARA no Umakai.
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: なお他に蘇我氏の血を天皇家に残したのは、蘇我稲目の娘である蘇我堅塩媛のみである。
sen.e: Incidentally, the only other person who introduced SOGA clan's blood in the imperial family's line was SOGA no Iname's daughter SOGA no Kitashihime.
Incidentally, the only other person who introduced SOGA clan blood to the imperial line was SOGA no Iname's daughter SOGA no Kitashihime.
sen.cmt: Minor change in grammar.
sen.e: Incidentally, the only other person who introduced Soga clan blood to the Imperial line was SOGA no Iname's daughter SOGA no Kitashihime.
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。Imperial大文字にしました。

sen.j: その系統は蘇我堅塩媛―桜井皇子―吉備姫王―皇極天皇―天智天皇―今上天皇となる。
sen.e: The lineage was in the following order; SOGA no Kitashihime, Sakurai no Oji, Kibitsuhime Okimi, Empress Kogyoku, Emperor Tenchi, and the present emperor.
The lineage is as follows : SOGA no Kitashihime, Sakurai no Oji, Kibitsuhime Okimi, Empress Kogyoku, Emperor Tenchi, and the present emperor.
sen.cmt: Minor grammatical change.
sen.e: The lineage is as follows: SOGA no Kitashihime, Sakurai no Oji, Kibitsuhime Okimi, Empress Kogyoku, Emperor Tenchi, and the present emperor.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 蘇我氏渡来人説
sen.e: The Theory of SOGA clan Originated as Toraijin
The Theory concerning the Migrant Origins of the SOGA Clan.
sen.cmt: Minor grammatical change.
sen.e: The Theory concerning the Migrant Origins of the Soga clan.
sen.cmt: Sogaに訂正しました。clan小文字にしました。

sen.j: 門脇禎二が1971年に提唱した「蘇我氏渡来人説」は学界を席巻しただけでなく、一般の古代史ファンにも広く受け入れられた。
sen.e: "The Theory of SOGA clan Originated as Toraijin," which was proposed by Teiji KADOWAKI in 1971, not only took the academic circle by storm but also was widely popular among the ancient history buffs.

"The Theory concerning the Migrant Origins of the SOGA Clan" took academic circles by storm when it was first proposed by KADOWAKI Teiji in 1971, and became widely popular among ancient history buffs.
sen.cmt: Minor grammatical changes, the title of the theory has been changed to be consistent with the abovemetioned correction.
sen.e: The theory concerning the migrant origins of the Soga clan' took academic circles by storm when it was first proposed by Teiji KADOWAKI in 1971, and became widely popular among ancient history buffs.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。'The theory concerning the migrant origins of the Soga clan'に訂正しました。Teiji KADOWAKIに訂正しました。

sen.j: 門脇が提唱したのは応神天皇の代に渡来した、百済の高官、木満致（もくまち）と蘇我満智（まち）が同一人物とする説で、鈴木靖民や山尾幸久らの支持を得た一方、加藤謙吉や坂本義種らが指摘したように、史料上の問題点が多く、蘇我氏を渡来人とみなす根拠は薄弱である。
sen.e: Yasutami SUZUKI and Yukihisa YAMAO supported the theory, on the other hand, as Kenkichi KATOU and Yoshitane SAKAMOTO pointed out there are many problems with the historical materials and the evidence to support the theory is weak.

SUZUKI Yasutami and YAMAO Yukihisa both supported KADOWAKI's assertion that the Baekje high official MOKU Machi, who is said to have arrived during the reign of Emperor Ojin, is one and the same individual as SOGA no Machi; but, as KATO Kenkichi and SAKAMOTO Yoshitane have pointed out, there are many historical discrepancies and little evidence to prove the migrant origins of the SOGA clan.
sen.cmt: Incomplete translation. Term "Soga no machi" should be "SOGA no Machi."
sen.e: Yasutami SUZUKI and Yukihisa YAMAO both supported Kadowaki's assertion that the Baekje high official Machi MOKU, who is said to have arrived during the reign of Emperor Ojin, is one and the same individual as SOGA no Machi; but, as Kenkichi KATO and Yoshitane SAKAMOTO have pointed out, there are many historical discrepancies and little evidence to prove the migrant origins of the Soga clan.
sen.cmt: Yasutami SUZUKI and Yukihisa YAMAO に訂正しました、Kadowakiに訂正しました。Machi MOKUに訂正しました。Kenkichi KATO and Yoshitane SAKAMOTOに訂正しました。Sogaに訂正しました。

sen.j: 問題点は整理すると以下の通りであり、木満致と蘇我満智を同一人物であると実証することは不可能である。
sen.e: The problematic points are summerized below and it is impossible to prove that SOGA no Machi and Machi MOKU were the same person.
As the issues listed below reveal, it is impossible to prove that SOGA no Machi and MOKU Machi were the same person.
sen.cmt: "Problematic points"--> "issues." Minor stylistic change.
sen.e: As the issues listed below reveal, it is impossible to prove that SOGA no Machi and Machi MOKU were the same person.
sen.cmt: Machi MOKUに訂正しました。

sen.j: 「木満致」の名が見える『日本書紀』の応神天皇25年（西暦294年、史料解釈上は414年）と「木刕満致」の名が見える『三国史記』百済本紀の蓋鹵王21年（西暦475年）とでは時代が異なる
sen.e: Machi MOKU' appears in "Nihonshoki" in 294, quoted in the theory as 414, and 'Manchi MOKURA' appears in History of Kudara of "Samguk Sagi" (History of the Three Kingdoms) in 475; these materials are from different periods in the history.

Whereas the name "MOKU Machi" appears in the "Nihonshoki" in 294 during the Emperor Ojin's reign, it is quoted in the historical interpretation as 414; Furthermore, "MOKURA Machi" appears in the History of Baekje of the "Samguk Sagi" (History of the Three Kingdoms) in 475, pointing to the chronological inconsistencies between the respective sources.
sen.cmt: Term is erroneously romanized as Mokura Manchi, when it should be Mokura Machi.
sen.e: Whereas the name 'Machi MOKU' appears in the "Nihonshoki" in 294 during the Emperor Ojin's reign, it is quoted in the historical interpretation as 414; Furthermore, 'Machi MOKURA' appears in the History of Baekje of the "Samguk Sagi" (History of the Three Kingdoms) in 475, pointing to the chronological inconsistencies between the respective sources.
sen.cmt: ダッシュ削除しました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。Machi MOKUに訂正しました。Machi MOKURAに訂正しました。

sen.j: 百済の名門氏族である木満致が、自らの姓を捨て蘇我氏を名乗ったことの不自然さ
sen.e: It is unlikely that Machi MOKU who was from a clan of pedigree in Kudara decided to disregard his family name and introduced himself as SOGA.
It is unlikely that Machi MOKU, a member of a well regarded clan in Baekje, would forsake his family name and introduce himself as SOGA.
sen.cmt: Minor grammatical correction. "clan of pedigree"--> well regarded clan.
sen.e: It is unlikely that Machi MOKU, a member of a well regarded clan in Baekje, would forsake his family name and introduce himself as Soga clan.
sen.cmt: Soga ckanに訂正しました。

sen.j: 渡来系豪族が自らの出自を改変するのは8世紀以降であること
sen.e: The clans of immigrants to ancient Japan changed their places of origin on their own accord after the eighth century.
Influential migrant clans in ancient Japan only began voluntarily changing their places of origin from the eighth century.
sen.cmt: 以降--> "from" not "after."
sen.e: Influential migrant clans in ancient Japan only began voluntarily changing their places of origin from the eighth century.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 木刕満致が「南行」したとの『三国史記』の記述がそのまま倭国へ渡来したことを意味しないこと
sen.e: Manchi MOKURA 'traveled to south,' the entry in "Samguk Sagi," doesn't mean literally he traveled to Wakoku (Japan).
The inscription in the "Samguk Sagi" describing MOKURA Machi as having "travelled south" does not indicate that he travelled to Wakoku (Japan).
sen.cmt: Again MOKURA Machi, not MOKURA Manchi.
sen.e: The inscription in the "Samguk Sagi" describing Machi MOKURA as having 'travelled south' does not indicate that he travelled to Wakoku (Japan).
sen.cmt: Machi MOKURAに訂正しました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 百済の名門氏族出身でありながら、孫の名前が高句麗を意味する高麗であること
sen.e: Machi MOKU was from a clan of pedigree in Kudara; however, his grandchild's name was Goryeo which meant "Goguryeo (the kingdom of Korea)."
Machi MOKU was from a prestegious clan in Baekje; However, his grandchild's name was Goryeo (高麗) which referred to the kingdom of "Goguryeo"(高句麗).
sen.cmt: Historically, after the defeat of Goguryeo by the Tang, neighboring kingdoms attempted usurp the repute of the former kingdom by calling themselves the descendents of Koguryo. So it is not that surprising that a Baekje official would name his grandchild Goryeo.
sen.e: Machi MOKU was from a prestigious clan in Baekje; however, his grandchild's name was Goryeo which referred to the kingdom of Goguryeo.
sen.cmt: prestigiousスペル訂正しました。however小文字にしました。漢字表記は不要と考え削除しました。原文に合せて" "削除しました。

sen.j: 満智の子は韓子（からこ）で、その子（稲目の父にあたる）は高麗（こま）という異国風の名前であった。
sen.e: Machi's child was Karako, and Karako's child, a father of Iname, was Koma which was like a foreign name.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Machi's named his child "Karako," (韓子; Korean "Hanja") and Karako, in turn, named his own child, who would later father Iname, "Koma" (高麗; Korean "Goryeo"), both of which are distinctly foreign-sounding names.
sen.cmt: Stylistic changes have been made. Korean added for good measure and coherence.Note : Term 千秋 has been mis-identified as senshuu. In this case it refers to the scholar Mizutani Chiaki.
sen.e: Machi named his child "Karako," (means Korean) and Karako, in turn, named his own child, who would later father Iname, "Koma" (means Goryeo), both of which are distinctly exotic names.
sen.cmt: Machi named his childに訂正しました。読み、漢字表記は不要と考え、"Karako," (means Korean)、"Koma" (means Goryeo)に訂正しました。exotic に訂正しました。

sen.j: そのことも渡来人説を生み出す要因となっているが、水谷千秋は「蘇我氏渡来人説」が広く受け入れられた背景を蘇我氏を逆賊とする史観と適合していたからではないかと述べている。
sen.e: Koma's foreign sounding name is one of the facts that lead to the theory of SOGA originated as toraijin; however, Chiaki MIZUTANI explained that the reason for the wide acceptance of "The Theory of SOGA clan Originated as Toraijin" is that the theory agrees with the historic view that SOGA clan was gyakuzoku (rebel).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The foreign sounding are one of the factors that gave cause to the "Theory of the Migrant Origins of the Soga Clan"; but, as MIZUTANI Chiaki explains, the theory's wide appeal was also underlined by its conformity to historical perception of the SOGA clans gyakuzoku (anti-establishment) allignment.
sen.cmt: The term gyakuzoku would be better translated as anti-establishment.
sen.e: Their exotic names are one of the factors that gave cause to 'the theory of the migrant origins of the Soga clan'; but, as Chiaki MIZUTANI explains, the theory's wide appeal was also underlined by its conformity to historical perception of the Soga clans anti-establishment alignment.
sen.cmt: alignmentスペル訂正しました。Their exotic namesに訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。'the theory of the migrant origins of the Soga clan'に訂正しました。Chiaki MIZUTANI に訂正しました。Sogaに訂正しました。逆賊の読みは不要と考え削除しました。

sen.j: また、韓子は『日本書紀』継体天皇24年秋9月の条の注に「大日本人娶蕃女所生為韓子也」（大日本人、蕃女（となりのくにのめ）を娶りて生めるを韓子とす）とされているように、倭韓混血児の通称であり、実在の人物名としては考えがたい。
sen.e: In addition, Karako was the common term used for Japanese-Korean mixed-race children found in the note for the entry of Fall September, 531 in "Nihonshoki," 'Karako means a child of a marriage between Japanese and a woman from the neighboring country'; it is hard to believe that Karako referred to an actual person.

Furthermore, "karako" as it is inscribed in the September 531 entry of the "Nihonshoki" refers to a "child born of union between a Japanese man and a woman from a neighboring country"; since Karako is a common term used to describe people of mixed Wa (Japanese) and Korean descent, it is hard to believe that it specified any individual.
sen.cmt: Separated into two sentences for consistency.
sen.e: Furthermore, "Karako" as it is inscribed in the September 531 entry of the "Nihonshoki" refers to a 'child born of union between a Japanese man and a woman from a neighboring country'; since Karako is a common term used to describe people of mixed Wa (Japanese) and Korean descent, it is hard to believe that it specified any individual.
sen.cmt: Karako大文字にしました。原文の「」に合せて" を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 武内宿禰以前は後世の架上と言われており、蘇我石川宿禰も子孫の石川氏による創作と見る説がある。
sen.e: TAKENOUCHI no Sukune allegedly was a fiction created in future generations and one theory says that Soganoishikawa no Sukune was also a fiction created by his descendant, ISHIKAWA clan.

TAKENOUCHI no Sukune was previously alleged to be a fiction created by subsequent generations, and there are also those who view Soganoishikawa no Sukune to be a creation of descendents of the ISHIKAWA clan.
sen.cmt: Stylistic changes.
sen.e: TAKENOUCHI no Sukune was previously alleged to be a fiction created by subsequent generations, and there are also those who view Soganoishikawa no Sukune to be a creation of descendents of the Ishikawa clan.
sen.cmt: Ishikawa に訂正しました。

sen.j: 2005年11月13日奈良文化財研究所は甘樫丘東麓遺跡で蘇我入鹿邸「谷の宮門」跡とみられる遺構を発掘したと発表、考古学者たちは『日本書紀』の記述が裏付けられるだろうと期待を寄せている。
sen.e: Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties announced that they excavated the ancient structural remnants thought to be "The gate of the palace in the valley" of SOGA no Iruka's regidence at Amakashi no Oka Toroku Site on November 13, 2005; the archeologists are hopeful that these ancient structural remnants will back up the entries in "Nihonshoki."

On November 13th, 2005 the Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties announced it had been excavating remnants of what is believe to be the "Valley Palace Gate" of SOGA no Iruka's residence at Amakashi no Oka Toroku Site; archeologists expect their findings to verify inscriptions in the"Nihonshoki."
sen.cmt: Translated into two sentences for consistency.
sen.e: On November 13th, 2005, the Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties announced it had been excavating remnants of what is believe to be the "Valley Palace Gate" of SOGA no Iruka's residence at Amakashi no Oka Toroku Site; archeologists expect their findings to verify inscriptions in the "Nihonshoki."
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。コンマ補足しました。
